clusters.title: Cost Reductions
clusters.description: Tesla experienced significant changes in 2024, with a notable 50% drop in stock value from its December peak. Despite a 13% decline in deliveries compared to the previous year, Tesla managed to reduce its average per-vehicle cost of goods sold from over $38,000 to under $35,000. The energy business contributed $10 billion to the company's revenue, while sales in China increased by 3% year-over-year. Analysts anticipate first-quarter revenue of $21.81 billion and an EPS of $0.43 per share. Looking ahead, Tesla is projected to achieve a 30% revenue growth rate by 2028, although salary expenses are expected to surpass $13 billion by then.

clusters.title: Market Share
clusters.description: Tesla's market share has significantly decreased from 60% in 2020 to 38% in 2024, indicating a decline in its dominance. The company has faced challenges with production and deliveries, with a 14% year-over-year drop in deliveries and a production decrease of roughly 600 vehicles. Despite these setbacks, Tesla's stock experienced a brief 3% rise, although it has been on a downward trend for nine consecutive weeks.

Tesla (TSLA) shares rose 3% shortly after markets opened Wednesday.
Shares dropped 5% yesterday.
Deliveries down 14% year-over-year.
Production was down 16% relative to the prior-year period.
Production down by roughly 600 vehicles.
Analysts expected 394,380 deliveries.
13,409 of the 410,244 vehicles produced were other models.
Recharging the battery from 5 to 80 percent takes slightly more than 30 minutes at a Tesla Supercharger.
The Model 3 Performance accelerates to 60 mph in 2.9 seconds.
Tesla’s stock has marked nine consecutive weeks of decline.
BYD's charging technology can deliver up to 400 kilometres of range after just five minutes.
The Long Range Rear-Wheel Drive has up to 387 miles of WLTP range.
Rapid charging speeds peak at 250kW for the Model Y.

related_facts.fact_group_content: The BMW iX scored 790 out of 1,000.
0 to 100km/h in 9.6 seconds.
Power consumption was 14.6kW/100km.
Battery capacity is around 60kWh.
Range is around 400km with full charge.
Tesla's profit margin, excluding regulatory credits, has contracted to 13.6%.
Tesla quotes 16.7kWh/100km for the Performance model.
An average of around 21kWh/100km was achieved in a cold week with the Tesla Model 3 Performance.
Tesla produced 362,615 vehicles in the first quarter of 2025.
Tesla's revenue was $21.3 billion in last year’s first quarter.

clusters.title: Delivery Metrics
clusters.description: In 2025, Tesla's performance was marked by significant vehicle production and delivery figures. The company produced 410,244 vehicles, slightly below analysts' expectations of 434,230. Tesla delivered over 384,000 vehicles in the second quarter, closely aligning with Wall Street's prediction of 385,000 deliveries. Additionally, Tesla's energy business contributed 10% to its total revenue in 2024, highlighting its diversified operations.

related_facts.fact_group_content: Tesla produced 362,615 vehicles in the first quarter of 2025.
Tesla's EPS was $0.45 in last year’s first quarter.
Tesla's total salary expenses are expected to rise by approximately 22% to 25% over the next five years.
The Model Y is 4.79-metres long.
The Model Y Rear-Wheel Drive has a 0-60mph time of 5.6 seconds.
The Long Range All-Wheel Drive has a 0-60mph time of 4.6 seconds.
The Model Y will manage a 10-80% top-up in well under 30 minutes.
The entry-level Model Y Rear-Wheel Drive starts at £44,990.
Tesla’s quickest version provides 275 kilometres after 15 minutes.
Wind noise is reduced by 30% according to Tesla.

clusters.title: Production Milestones
clusters.description: Tesla's performance in 2025 is marked by significant production achievements and technological advancements. The company produced 362,615 vehicles in the first quarter, showcasing its manufacturing capabilities. Tesla's vehicles, such as the Model Y, offer impressive features like rapid charging and competitive acceleration times. Additionally, Tesla is focusing on reducing wind noise and improving range efficiency, enhancing the overall driving experience.
